required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Short Term Effects of Oceanix Supplementation on Recovery
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Short Term Oceanix Supplementation on Muscle Mass, Strength, and Power Underneath Extreme Training Conditions in Healthy and Elite Athletic Populations

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study will be to examine the effects of Oceanix supplementation on full body strength, velocity, and mechanics following an overtraining cycle meant to mimic the stress faced by strength and power athletes during intense tournaments. Twenty active males and females will be recruited for the study. Subjects will be randomly divided by 50% into an Oceanix supplement or placebo condition.
Following randomization, subjects will be baseline tested on lower body anaerobic power, lower body power and strength, full-body power, force, and velocity, and overall body mechanics. Subjects will also be assessed for their immune function, endocrine function, and oxidative stress. After baseline testing is complete, the participants will be asked to refrain from exercise, and supplement for 7 days with their specified condition (Oceanix supplement or placebo). Following those initial 7 day supplementation, subjects will then be put on an intensified overreaching protocol for 5 days and retested 24 hours following completion of the 5 days. Subjects will then be given 48 hours to recover (from completion of the 5-day overreaching protocol) and be retested again.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in Muscle Strength (Forces exerted in kg)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 24-Hours Post Last Training Day, 48-Hours Post Last Training Day
primary_outcome.description: Assessed by Isometric Mid-Thigh Pull and Isometric Bench Press.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 24-Hours Post Last Training Day, 48-Hours Post Last Training Day
primary_outcome.description: Assessed through ground reaction forces during countermovement and squat jumps on a force plate.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in Subjective Perceived Recovery Scale (PRS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 24-Hours Post Last Training Day, 48-Hours Post Last Training Day
primary_outcome.description: Assessed through a visual analog scale numbered 0 - 10 with visual descriptors. For example, at 0 the descriptor is "very poorly recovered/extremely tired" and at 10 the descriptor is "very well recovered/highly energetic".

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Subjective Rating of Perceived Exertion (RPE)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 24-Hours Post Last Training Day, 48-Hours Post Last Training Day
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed through a visual analog scale (modified Borg Scale) numbered 0 - 10 with visual descriptors. For example, at 0 the descriptor is "at rest" and at 10 the descriptor is "maximal exertion".

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Creatine Kinase in Response to Exercise
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 24-Hours Post Last Training Day, 48-Hours Post Last Training Day
secondary_outcome.description: Experimental outcome examining creatine kinase in fasted whole blood samples. This biomarker is an indirect measure of muscle damage.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 24-Hours Post Last Training Day, 48-Hours Post Last Training Day
secondary_outcome.description: Experimental outcome examining the concentration of IgA in fasted saliva sample.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 24-Hours Post Last Training Day, 48-Hours Post Last Training Day
secondary_outcome.description: Experimental outcome examining the concentration of cortisol in fasted saliva samples.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 24-Hours Post Last Training Day, 48-Hours Post Last Training Day
secondary_outcome.description: Experimental outcome examining the concentration of testosterone in fasted saliva samples.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 24-Hours Post Last Training Day, 48-Hours Post Last Training Day
secondary_outcome.description: Experimental outcome examining superoxide dimutase in fasted whole blood samples. This is another protective antioxidant enzyme measured from whole blood.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 24-Hours Post Last Training Day, 48-Hours Post Last Training Day
secondary_outcome.description: Experimental outcome examining total antioxidant capacity in fasted whole blood samples. The TAX measures the overall collective power of the blood to neutralize free radicals.

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 24-Hours Post Last Training Day, 48-Hours Post Last Training Day
other_outcome.description: Changes in resting systolic blood pressure.

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 24-Hours Post Last Training Day, 48-Hours Post Last Training Day
other_outcome.description: Changes in resting diastolic blood pressure.

other_outcome.measure: Repetitions Executed on a Bulgarian Split Squat
other_outcome.description: Recorded the number of repetitions executed during a Bulgarian Split Squat on the last day of training.

arm_group.description: Participants will engage in a 5-day resistance training program while simultaneously consuming the treatment condition (Oceanixâ„¢) 30 minutes prior to exercise on training days or with the first meal of the day on non-training days.

Participants will engage in a 5-day resistance training program while simultaneously consuming the Placebo condition (25mg hydroxypropyl methylcellulose) 30 minutes prior to exercise on training days or with the first meal of the day on non-training days.

intervention.description: Ingredient contains highly active antioxidant enzymes, including superoxide dismutase (SOD), as well as essential fatty acids, vitamins, amino acids and minerals.
5 days of supervised and programmed whole-body resistance training.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- At least 1 year of consistent resistance training experience (i.e. three days per week).
- Physically active males and females aged 18 to 45 years old.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Having a BMI of 30 or more kg/mÂ²
- Having cardiovascular, metabolic, or endocrine disease.
- Undergone surgery that affects digestion and absorption.
- Smoking
- Drinking heavily (> 7 and > 14 drinks per week for women and men, respectively).
- Women who are pregnant or planning to be pregnant.
- Taking medication to control blood pressure, lipids, and blood glucose
- Have taken or currently taking anabolic-androgenic steroids.
